views.markdown:
Unpack the full potential of your device with a proper package manager for iOS 12 and higher!

Sileo is a package manager for iOS that allows users to find and install packages on jailbroken iOS devices. Sileo is based on APT, ported to iOS.

#### Native and Modern

Sileo has been designed and built from the ground up to work properly with all devices on iOS 12+. It features a modern UI that emphasises native UI elements, with fully native package depictions on supported repos! It also allows repositories to handle payments seamlessly and natively with payments secured by Touch/Face ID.

Sileo uses the latest versions of both DPKG and APT to ensure that users get the best possible experience with the latest optimizations and stability fixes applied for both. Both DPKG and APT have minimal patches to ensure they may continue to be updated, while still being compatible with most existing iOS repositories.

#### Fast

Sileo has been designed from the ground up to run quickly and efficiently. Repositories load faster, without blocking the UI to reload data. Many infrequently-used APT features have not been brought over to Sileo to keep it lean and fast.

#### Integrated

Because Sileo has been built with the latest DPKG and APT in mind, they all have been updated to ensure they work together in the most efficient manner possible. Great effort has been taken to ensure that the entire process from app launch to package installation has been streamlined, with no processes being duplicated where possible, to ensure a better, faster, and more stable overall experience.

#### Free

Sileo is available, free of charge, for all devices on iOS 12 and up

- Swipe actions on tweaks for installing, upgrading, uninstalling, adding repo
- Canister Implementation for searching for tweaks on repos you don't have. You can Add the Repo and have the package queued for you
- Haptic feedback for swipe actions and the queue button
- Alternative icons
- Refreshing sources no longer clears the queue
- Made adding multiple sources at once significantly faster
- Relocated ignored upgrades to their own section, with an option to hide them entirely
- Search now queries for package identifier, name, author, maintainer, and description
- Made alphabetical sorting case-insensitive
- Show Number of Packages installed from that repo on the sources page
- Option to auto complete queue
- Option to complete queue later
- ModMyTTD has been removed as a default repo
- Updated 3D Touch shortcuts
- Adjusted the Background App Refresh prompt
- Ability to restart/retry a download if the download failed 
- Fixed lag when tapping the Done button
- Fixed duplicate repos
- Fixed icons being blank on the sources list view
- Fixed refreshing repos on launch
- Fixed tapping the Sources tab bar to return to the root sources menu
- Fixed certain settings not showing up under certain localizations
- Added more localizations
- Added a Developer Mode toggle
- Added a Backend Class that tweak developers can use to interface with Sileo's backend
- Removed unnecessary dependencies
- Memory improvements
- Performance improvements
- Fix links in depictions
- When pressing packages tab bar item, scroll to top of list
- All analytics have been removed

- Fix a crash on quickly changing in and out of new
- Fix bold text crash
- Fix payment crash
- Payment will now be cancelled upon cancelling biometric
- Fix colour picker presentation on iPad
- Remove user filtering, everyone is developer now
- Fix mismatch theme crash
- Fix sign out crash on iPad
- Should fix the respring button being slow
- Sileo will no longer crash upon updating itself
- Fix adding a repo from link
- Adjust some button colours
- Fix share sheet presentation on iPad
Fix issues with downloading paid packages.

1. New tab rewritten in Swift so it runs way faster
2. Re-adds piracy warning when adding piracy repos (but doesn't block them)
3. Adds a new theming system with custom tint colors
4. Fix network access on Chinese devices
5. Add DepictionLayerView class for depictions
6. Extends DepictionButtonView class for depictions
1. Fix local deb installation
Version number reserved for Chimera -> Procursus migration
1. Fix regression in 1.9.0 that caused a crash on launch with certain languages

1. Sileo 1.9.0 is now 82% Swift!
2. Objective-C inter-op has been removed from most parts of the backend! This should offer a significant performance boost
3. No longer use deprecated iOS status bar APIs
4. Fix queue bar glitch on iOS 11 / 12
5. Sileo user agent now correctly reports minor Sileo versions
6. Begin testflighting some updates for the depiction spec
7. Replace UICKeychainStore with KeychainAccess

1. Payment API is now written in Swift
2. Usernames now show up properly in the profile view
3. Repo icons now show up properly in the profile view
4. Repo names are now peoperly sorted alphabetically and aren't separated by uppercase/lowercase
5. Ignored package updates no longer increment the badge on the tab or app
6. Fixes a crash that can occur with Chinese localization
1. Fix an issue that could cause Sileo to crash on launch
1. Fix APT pinning with Procursus bootstrap
1. Fix GET button performance
1. Fix performance issues with the new tab
1. Attempt to fix APT pinning with procursus repo

1. Fix addition of full BigBoss.
2. RepoProxy renamed from 'BigBoss+' to 'ModMyTTD+' to signify the repos its mirroring now

1. Sileo 1.8 now launches and refreshes sources 3x faster than Sileo 1.7!
2. Full BigBoss repo is now available in Sileo (New Tab might be a bit slow, but everything else should still be faster than 1.7)

1. Fix a crash with iPads on iOS 12.x
2. Make repos refresh faster in case of down/slow repos

1. Add Editorials in the New Tab Cards
2. New Tab UI is now written in Swift
3. Cydia Scraper is now written in Swift
1. Fix dark mode colors on iOS 13
1. Fix blur glitches on iOS 13
1. Fix an issue where dependencies would fail after tapping a repo in the sources list
1. Fix installation issues on the checkrain jailbreak

1. 10x faster GET button
2. 10x faster package installation
3. Now has full support for the checkrain jailbreak

1. 5x Faster markdown renderer. Should give a noticeable speed boost when loading depictions on repos fully updated for Sileo (e.g. Chimera repo)
2. Fix remaining visual bugs on iOS 13
3. Add Chariz Repo
4.Deprecate 'useRawFormat' (this forces the older, slower renderer -- turn this off to get the new fast markdown renderer)

1. Fix visual bugs on iOS 13.1
2. iOS 13 dark mode support is now mostly consistent with the dark mode design on iOS 11 and 12

1. Bug Fixes
2. Adds a 3rd-party analytics framework. No personal identifying information is collected. The only data collected are number of active users, the iOS version/device model and the jailbreak Sileo is being run on (e.g. Electra vs Chimera)

1. Add dark mode, now built into Sileo
2. Add support for iOS 13
3. Sileo 1.5 now launches and refreshes repos 30% faster than 1.4
4. Bundle depiction scrapers for more repos
5. More of Sileo has been rewritten in Swift for speed and reliability
6. Remove Chariz repo

1. Fix an issue with opening URLs in Sileo from Safari
2. Reduce clutter on certain native depictions

1. Sileo is now 55% Swift!
2. Queue bar now shows up more reliably when the GET button is tapped
3. Sileo 1.4.0 launches and refreshes sources 3x faster than 1.3.5
4. Add support for converting Web depictions to native (BigBoss and MacCiti supported currently)
5. Enable Javascript on web depictions
6. Fix scrolling of package depictions
7. Reduce spam/clutter from certain depictions
8. Featured page now loads instantly on app launch
9. Create an API for users to be able to add their own web -> native depiction scrapers
10. Depiction Scrapers open sourced under the BSD license

1. Rewrite Installation components in Swift
2. Fix repos not refreshing properly

1. Allow logging out of repos that are not loading paid purchases properly
2. Rewrite Featured tab in Swift
1. Fix error with package installations on BSD Utilities
1. Fix sources not installing correctly on BSD Utilities

1. Fix files displaying incorrectly as folders in the "Installed Packages" list.
2. Switch to zsh as the default shell in Sileo

1. Rewrite Installed Package Contents view in Swift
2. Fix dependency resolution issues
3. Fix crashes when dependencies failed to resolve
4. Adds support for downloading in the background
